page.title: 08Markets
page.content: There are many street markets in the area, the most famous being 'Petticoat Lane'. This stretches along Wentworth Street from Aldgate to Liverpool Bishopsgate. It is open on Wednesdays and Sundays, the Sunday opening being most popular. Often the crowds are so great it is almost impossible to walk freely along the main trading roads. There is a sign up near the Aldgate End saying 'Welcome to the World Famous Petticoat Lane Market.' Indeed, it has become a major tourist attraction. On sale are clothes, new and used, toys, records, and all kinds of brick-a-brack. The market was started by the local Jewish people early this century; the new Asian community now take an active part in maintaining the hustle and bustle of 'The Lane'.
